summary: A Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019, reporting a failure of the NICEVision camera system on August 8, 2019, which prevented the recovery of video footage from the 5-South Housing Unit and all other cameras. The communication technician was notified and planned to fix the system on August 9, 2019.

keyFacts: On August 8, 2019, the NICEVision camera system at MCC New York failed, preventing the recovery of any video footage from the 5-South Housing Unit and all other cameras.
The camera system failure was discovered at approximately 3:45 PM by an SIS Lieutenant during a review.
A Communication Technician confirmed the system was not recording and there was no way to retrieve any video, planning to fix it on August 9, 2019.
The memorandum is dated August 10, 2019, documenting a critical surveillance failure at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
The specific mention of the 5-South Housing Unit is notable as it was likely where high-profile inmates, including Epstein, were housed.
